column2: Professional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement35\r\rAll training and curriculum development at Coachella Valley Unified School District revolves around the California State Standards and Frameworks and\rCommon Core State Standards. The district’s Educational Services Division works closely with school administrators
column4: and the superintendent to\ridentify staff training needs based upon review of student performance data results
column6: and principal input.\r\rStaff members refine teaching skills and concepts through participation in conferences and workshops throughout the year. Training activities typically\rrelate to the teacher’s area of expertise and covers innovative strategies and techniques to improve student achievement and the quality of classroom\rinstruction. Teachers may participate in district-sponsored seminars presented by district personnel
column8: and lead teachers.\r\rClassified staff receive job-related training from qualified district personnel and consultants. Special education aides received specialized training from\rdistrict office personnel. Long-term substitute teachers are invited to attend designated training sessions.\r\r2019-20 District-Sponsored Professional Development:\r\r* Joven Noble\r\r* Xinatchli\r\r* Transformational Learning Training\r\r* Restorative Justice Training\r\r* PBIS Training\r•\rCAASPP Summative and Interim Assessment Block (IAB) training\r\r* ELPAC Initial and Summative training\r\r* English 3D\r\r* Rosetta Stone\r\r* Project Moving Forward - vocabulary
column10: and language development\r•\rAVID Path to Schoolwide Trainings\r•\rAVID Summer Institute\r•\rBest Practices Relating to the ELA/ELD Standards and Frameworks\r•\rBiliteracy Units of Study\r•\rCommon Core State Standards Implementation\r•\rEADMS Training for Assessment Implementation and Data Analysis\r\r* University of California Irvine (UCI) Math training for middle school and high school\r\r* Writing professional development provided by Riverside County Office of Education (RCOE)\r\r* Accelerating Academic Learning for English Learners\r\rThe district offers two distinct programs to support professional growth and improve instruction in the classroom. The Beginning Teacher Support and\rAssessment program offers support and newly credentialed teachers. All participating new teachers are provided peer support over a two-year period.\rThe and Review (PAR) program to veteran teachers who instructional skills
column13: and/or related aspects of their\rteaching performance. Experienced and knowledgeable teachers
column15: are paired with teachers referred to the PAR program to\rprovide individualized guidance
